AD Basics.name: Active Directory Fundamentals
AD Basics.title: Active Directory Fundamentals
AD Basics.excerpt: A comprehensive guide to Active Directory structure, objects, group policies, and authentication protocols.

Enumerating Active Directory.name: Active Directory Enumeration & Credential Injection
Enumerating Active Directory.title: Active Directory Enumeration & Credential Injection
Enumerating Active Directory.excerpt: Techniques for injecting credentials using runas, verifying access, and performing deep AD enumeration using MMC, CMD, PowerShell, and Bloodhound.

Lateral Movement and Pivoting.name: Lateral Movement & Pivoting
Lateral Movement and Pivoting.title: Lateral Movement & Pivoting
Lateral Movement and Pivoting.excerpt: Comprehensive techniques for moving laterally through a Windows domain using remote execution, WMI, and alternate authentication materials.

DLL.name: Introduction to Dynamic Link Libraries (DLLs)
DLL.title: Introduction to Dynamic Link Libraries (DLLs)
DLL.excerpt: Understanding the fundamentals of DLLs, their modular benefits, and a practical code example for creating a simple exported function.

Manual DLL Call.name: Manual DLL Function Calling
Manual DLL Call.title: Manual DLL Function Calling
Manual DLL Call.excerpt: A guide to dynamic function resolution in Windows using GetModuleHandle, LoadLibrary, and GetProcAddress for modularity and evasion.

AES tiny.name: Shellcode Encryption with Tiny AES
AES tiny.title: Shellcode Encryption with Tiny AES
AES tiny.excerpt: Implementing minimal AES-128 encryption and decryption for shellcode payloads using the Tiny AES library in C.

Encryption.name: Shellcode Obfuscation & Encryption
Encryption.title: Shellcode Obfuscation & Encryption
Encryption.excerpt: An overview of why shellcode encryption is vital for bypassing AV/EDR and a comparison of common encryption algorithms.

RC4 Native API.name: RC4 Stream Cipher (Native API)
RC4 Native API.title: RC4 Stream Cipher (Native API)
RC4 Native API.excerpt: Implementing RC4 encryption and decryption using the undocumented Windows SystemFunction032/033 for stealthy shellcode obfuscation.

XOR 1 Key.name: Single-Key XOR Obfuscation
XOR 1 Key.title: Single-Key XOR Obfuscation
XOR 1 Key.excerpt: Implementing basic single-byte XOR encryption for shellcode, including a variation using index-based key rotation for improved entropy.

XOR KEYS.name: Multi-Key XOR Encryption
XOR KEYS.title: Multi-Key XOR Encryption
XOR KEYS.excerpt: A guide to implementing multi-byte XOR encryption for shellcode payloads, providing better entropy and resistance to simple brute-forcing compared to single-byte methods.

Execution.name: Shellcode Execution & Injection Strategies
Execution.title: Shellcode Execution & Injection Strategies
Execution.excerpt: An overview of stealthy techniques for transitioning shellcode from a static buffer into active execution, focusing on living-off-the-land and API abuse.

Local Dll Execution.name: Local DLL Execution
Local Dll Execution.title: Local DLL Execution
Local Dll Execution.excerpt: A practical guide to dynamically loading and executing DLLs locally using LoadLibraryA, including a breakdown of the DllMain entry point and execution flow.

Local Payload Execution.name: Local Payload Execution
Local Payload Execution.title: Local Payload Execution
Local Payload Execution.excerpt: A technical guide on executing binary payloads directly in a local process's memory space using VirtualAlloc, VirtualProtect, and CreateThread.

Remote Dll injection.name: Remote DLL Injection
Remote Dll injection.title: Remote DLL Injection
Remote Dll injection.excerpt: A technical deep dive into injecting a Dynamic-Link Library (DLL) into a remote process using VirtualAllocEx, WriteProcessMemory, and CreateRemoteThread.

Remote ShellCode Injection.name: Remote Shellcode Injection
Remote ShellCode Injection.title: Remote Shellcode Injection
Remote ShellCode Injection.excerpt: A step-by-step guide and code implementation for injecting encrypted shellcode into a remote process using OpenProcess, VirtualAllocEx, and CreateRemoteThread.

Make Malware.name: Modular Malware Development & Defense Evasion
Make Malware.title: Modular Malware Development & Defense Evasion
Make Malware.excerpt: An introduction to the modular architecture of modern malware, focusing on the layers of encryption, obfuscation, and execution required to bypass EDR/AV solutions.

Obfuscation.name: The Art of Obfuscation
Obfuscation.title: The Art of Obfuscation
Obfuscation.excerpt: An exploration of techniques used to mask the intent and structure of shellcode loaders, including environmental keying and data masquerading.

To IPs.name: IPv4 Masquerading (Obfuscation)
To IPs.title: IPv4 Masquerading (Obfuscation)
To IPs.excerpt: A technique leveraging IPv4 address encoding to transform raw shellcode bytes into a list of human-readable IP strings, bypassing static signature-based detection.

Payload Placement.name: Payload Placement Architectures
Payload Placement.title: Payload Placement Architectures
Payload Placement.excerpt: An analysis of staged vs. stageless payload architectures, focusing on the trade-offs between network stealth, file size, and detection surface.

HTTP Stageing.name: HTTP Stager & Remote Payload Delivery
HTTP Stageing.title: HTTP Stager & Remote Payload Delivery
HTTP Stageing.excerpt: Understanding and implementing HTTP-based stagers for dynamic payload retrieval and in-memory execution using the WinINet API.

Staged Payload.name: Staging & Multi-Stage Payloads
Staged Payload.title: Staging & Multi-Stage Payloads
Staged Payload.excerpt: An introduction to the staging process, explaining how small initial payloads are used to retrieve and execute larger implants directly in memory to minimize the detection footprint.

In Data Section.name: Data Placement Payload in Data Section
In Data Section.title: Data Placement Payload in Data Section
In Data Section.excerpt: Understanding how shellcode is stored within the initialized data segments (.data or .rdata) of a Portable Executable and its implications for static analysis.

In Rdata section.name: Data Placement Payload in .rdata Section
In Rdata section.title: Data Placement Payload in .rdata Section
In Rdata section.excerpt: Exploring the use of the read-only data section (.rdata) for shellcode storage and the memory protection requirements for execution.

In Rsrc Section.name: Data Placement Payload in Resource Section (RSRC)
In Rsrc Section.title: Data Placement Payload in Resource Section (RSRC)
In Rsrc Section.excerpt: Leveraging the Windows Portable Executable (PE) resource system to embed and retrieve shellcode payloads using FindResource, LoadResource, and LockResource APIs.

In Text Secrion.name: Data Placement Payload in .text Section
In Text Secrion.title: Data Placement Payload in .text Section
In Text Secrion.excerpt: Placing shellcode directly into the .text section (code segment) to inherit native execution permissions and bypass certain memory allocation signatures.

Stageless Payload.name: Stageless Payloads & PE Data Placement
Stageless Payload.title: Stageless Payloads & PE Data Placement
Stageless Payload.excerpt: An overview of stageless payload architecture and how developers leverage internal Portable Executable (PE) sections to hide malicious code within a single binary.

Windows API.name: The Windows API (WinAPI)
Windows API.title: The Windows API (WinAPI)
Windows API.excerpt: An introduction to the Windows API, its architecture, and the specific data types required for low-level system interaction and malware development.

GetModuleHandelw.name: WinAPI: GetModuleHandleW
GetModuleHandelw.title: WinAPI: GetModuleHandleW
GetModuleHandelw.excerpt: Understanding GetModuleHandleW for retrieving base addresses of loaded modules, a critical step for dynamic function resolution and API hooking.

LoadLibrary.name: WinAPI: LoadLibraryW
LoadLibrary.title: WinAPI: LoadLibraryW
LoadLibrary.excerpt: An overview of LoadLibraryW for dynamic DLL loading, enabling runtime function access and stealthy API usage.

Allocate Memory.name: WinAPI Memory Allocation
Allocate Memory.title: WinAPI Memory Allocation
Allocate Memory.excerpt: A technical comparison of malloc, HeapAlloc, and LocalAlloc for allocating process memory on Windows systems.

Memcpy.name: Buffer Operations: memcpy
Memcpy.title: Buffer Operations: memcpy
Memcpy.excerpt: Understanding how to use the memcpy function to transfer data between buffers, specifically for moving payloads into allocated memory.

CreateFile.name: WinAPI File Creation: CreateFileW
CreateFile.title: WinAPI File Creation: CreateFileW
CreateFile.excerpt: Understanding the CreateFile API for creating, opening, and managing file handles on Windows, a fundamental step for staging payloads or exfiltrating data.

MessageBox.name: WinAPI User Interaction: MessageBox
MessageBox.title: WinAPI User Interaction: MessageBox
MessageBox.excerpt: Understanding the MessageBox API for displaying modal dialogs, handling user input, and its use in environmental keying or sandbox detection.
